summary:
The Security Council:

Recalling previous resolutions on Liberia and Sierra Leone, particularly resolution 1626 (2005) which authorized UNMIL military personnel to provide security for the Special Court for Sierra Leone,

Welcoming the Secretary-General's letter of 11 February 2011,

Expressing appreciation for UNMIL's contribution to the Court's security,

Noting the Registrar's letter of 13 October 2010 and the Government of Sierra Leone's request to postpone withdrawal,

Acting under Chapter VII of the Charter,

1. Decides to discontinue the authorization granted in resolution 1626 (2005) and requests UNMIL to withdraw military personnel providing security for the Court by 7 March 2011;

2. Discontinues the authorization to UNMIL to evacuate Court officials in the event of a security crisis;

3. Looks forward to local security personnel providing security for the Court and requests UNIPSIL to include Court officials in existing security evacuation arrangements.
